Tried downloading the Ogg vid from the public domain but that was a no-go, apparently, and my internet connection is too slow to watch the mp4 streamed without extreme irritation and about 3 hours to watch 1 hour.

@formerly_azrielle: It's marked as "DVD ready", meaning MPEG-2 and strict compliance with DVD authoring tools (I did literary thousands of such MPEG-2 encodes for mastering purposes, while back). Size is pretty small - regarding that factors - and quality of public-domain movies is obscure, same as the titles too. Mark the title, right-click and do plain Google - maybe is some small avi available.

@formerly_azrielle: I checked on Google, and lot of bullshit as usual.
However, 277 MB iPhone encode and 638 MB wmv seems as available for download.
http://free-classic-movies.com/movies/1936-Earthworm-Tractors/
and download, not watch on-line. Google video has it too, crappy one, but you can (should) download any, not watch it on-line. Your connection (line) speed is irrelevant, restrictions usually came from semi-choked streaming servers.
